name: Nezu Kamachiku
description: The signature dish is udon. You choose between hot (kama-age udon) or cold (zaru udon), the size (regular or large) and the toppings. The plain option comes with green onions, ginger and tempura flakes. The decor in a 1910s former brick warehouse next to a modern building is amazing. The communal table with view on the Japanese garden is particularly nice. Prices start at ¥990.

name: Pizza 17
description: Best pizza in Tokyo ! The place is tiny: downstairs you sit at the counter where you can watch the chef, upstairs a few tables are more quiet. The pizza is the perfect balance between chewy and crispy. One mandatory drink per person.

name: Kitayoshi - 喜多由(きたよし)
description: Self-prepared okonomiyaki. The place has been popular in the neighborhood for years. It's local (no website, no social media, only phone), friendly and cheap. On the menu, there are also monja (more liquid with stock) and yaki soba.

name: Izumi sushi - 和泉鮨
description: Set lunch menu for 1,300¥ makes it the best value for sushi. For this price, you get miso soup, 6 nigiri and 6 maki, including 2 tuna nigiri which are the best we've found so far. We come here twice a week and never get bored.

name: Togoshiya
description: Small place that serves onigiri in Shibuya. Seats are on a long counter. You order from a table hidden a small drawer. Onigiri comes in 2 sizes (regular and big) and are around 300¥ each. After trying them here, you will never be able to go back to onigiri from the kombini.

name: Tenkazushi
description: Conveyor belt sushi of decent quality. The location in a basement of Dogenzaka's main street is convenient and there is no need to book, even though it's not suitable for big parties as seats are around a counter. You can take plates from the conveyor belt or ask the chefs to make something from the menu.

name: Yuuyuu - ゆうゆう食堂
description: Local traditional Japanese canteen. It's basically like going to your grandma's for lunch. The food is simple homemade dishes like fried fish and katsu curry, accompanied with soup, salad and picked vegetables. A set menu costs ¥1,100 and will fill your belly.

name: Yakitori Todorokiten
description: Right next to Yuuyuu, this place is a locals' favourites. You write your order on a small piece of paper (yes, in Japanese), including the sauce: tare (soy sauce) or shio (salt). It's not the cleanest of places but the karaage is delicious and the atmosphere is typical of a Japanese bar.

name: Banh Xeo Saigon
description: A place to fix your craving for Vietnamese food. Pho, banh cuon (sadly without cha), banh xeo and excellent cha gio.

name: Fanji Xi'an Meat Dumplings - 凡記 西安肉夾饃
description: Ikebukuro is the new Chinatown. This sichuan restaurant is very appreciated by the Chinese community living in the neighborhood. Food is legit spicy !

name: Sanaka
description: A tiny place hidden in the hip area of Harajuku. It's located in a residential building above a grocery store, you have to go up the stairs to the 2F. Take one of the set menus and, if you sit at the counter, the chef will put the sushi in your plate as you eat. Arrive early !

name: Tempura Kanno
description: Excellent family restaurant in a quiet and local neighborhood. The owners are the sweetest of people and the food is amazing.

name: Sushi no midori
description: The place listed here is inside Shibuya Mark City but there are also branches in Umegaoka (the original), Ginza and Asakasa. There is always a queue but you can take a ticket and follow the virtual queue on Line (the application called Line, it's not a typo). Very decent sushi platters for a decent price.

name: Flipper's
description: Instagrammable pancake place ! The pancakes are fuwa fuwa, like a jingling cloud. There are plenty of toppings to choose from, however there is usually a bit of a wait. Prices are around ¥1,400 for 3 pancakes, enough for 2 people to share as a snack. There are also branches in Jiyugaoka, Shimo Kitazawa and Kichijoji.

name: Spontini
description: Coming from Milan, it's a fast food place that makes super thick pizza. They are fried underneath, which makes them crispy. It's a bit hidden but there is plenty of room.

name: Yai Yai
description: Okonomiyaki place in the heart of Harajuku. No need to book, you just have to queue. You don't cook it yourself but if you sit at the counter, you can watch the chef cook.

name: Cold Stone Creamery Tokyo
description: Ice cream in a cone shaped like a bowl with many toppings. The staff will sing a song while making your ice cream. There is a beautiful wall for pictures. To go only.

name: Gonpachi Nori Temaki
description: This place serves a great selection of temaki (big sushi that you eat with the hand). You roll them yourself. You sit around a massive counter.
